remarks: Ring homomorphism depends only on the ring attributes of structures. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2015.)
statement:
rhmpropd.a $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` J ) ) $.
rhmpropd.b $e |- ( ph -> C = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
rhmpropd.c $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
rhmpropd.d $e |- ( ph -> C = ( Base ` M ) ) $.
rhmpropd.e $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` J ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
rhmpropd.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. C /\ y e. C ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` M ) y ) ) $.
rhmpropd.g $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` J ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` L ) y ) ) $.
rhmpropd.h $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. C /\ y e. C ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` M ) y ) ) $.
rhmpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( J RingHom K ) = ( L RingHom M ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d M x y $.
$d ph x y $.
